Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C)

In an environment of numerous sub-domains it is annoying to scroll through the whole list of cookies of the whole 1st lvl domain (and its sub-domains).

I suggest that if the 2nd lvl domain is not www or something trivial the 2nd lvl domain of the currently displayed page is used in the search-bar of the cookies window. May be this is contradictory to the cookie-spec, but i don't think so.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
PageInfo -> Security -> Cookies
Actual Results:  
The whole 1st lvl domain is listed

Expected Results:  
just the cookies of the 2nd lvl domain are listed

Happens with all kind of builds (debian sid x86_64 aswell)

Reporter, when you go to PageInfo -> Security -> Cookies, there is a search field at the top of the PageInfo window, that is autofilled with mozilla.org. All you have to do is change that to bugzilla.mozilla.org to filter only for your 2nd level domain.

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Reporter, when you go to PageInfo -> Security -> Cookies, there is a search
> field at the top of the PageInfo window, that is autofilled with mozilla.org.
> All you have to do is change that to bugzilla.mozilla.org to filter only for
> your 2nd level domain.

Sure, that's pretty easy. But as you display PageInfo for the current page, why not the same restriction to cookies? I don't understand, for what reason i might be interested in all cookies of the whole domain. So i suggest that the default of the search field on that window is adjusted to 2nd lvl domains.
